item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Legislative Report
subitem_blurb: Status and possible action on pending legislation. (JA/SC-SF)

subitem_title: Public Education Grant Program
subitem_blurb: Informational presentation on an equity analysis of Fiscal Year 2021/2022 Whale Tail Grants (KD, AKF – SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0409 (Carol Wade Langston and Oren Eugene Langston Trust, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Carol Wade Langston and Oren Eugene Langston Trust to remove and replace 356 sq.ft. dock with new 355 sq.ft. dock and reuse two 14” guide piles and 54 sq.ft. gangway at 16611 Nalu Circle, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (JD-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0411 (Coldren, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Rob and Brook Coldren to reconfigure U-shaped dock, including: 1) relocate left finger 2 ft. left; 2) narrow center finger; 3) relocate two guide piles; reconfigured dock system would result in no additional fill and 32 sq. ft. decrease of overwater coverage at 815 Via Lido Soud, Newport Beach, Orange County. (AS-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Chief of Enforcement on Statewide Enforcement Program. (LAH-SF)

Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-NPB-21-0036-1, Part D (Transfers of Development Rights).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Newport Beach to amend both the Land Use Plan (LUP) and Implementation Plan (IP) portions of the certified LCP to add one new LUP policy and add new IP section outlining procedures for transfer of development rights from a property to one or more other properties in Newport Beach, Orange County. (LR-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0903 (Las Vegas Beach House LLP, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application of Las Vegas Beach House LLP to remove approx. 1,000-sq.ft. one-story, 11.5-ft.-high mobile home; and install approx. 1,494-sq.ft., one-story, 16-ft. high mobile home with patio, storage shed, front yard planters and entry door on beachfront mobile home space at 1880 N. El Camino Real, Unit 43, San Clemente, Orange County. (MA-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CII-21-0040-1 (West Oaks)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Carlsbad to amend its certified Land Use Plan and Implementation Plan to redesignate land uses on nine parcels located southwest of the intersection of Palomar Airport Road and Palomar Oaks Way from Planned Industrial and Open Space (OS) to Residential (R-30) and OS, and rezone from Planned Industrial and OS to Residential Density-Multiple and OS. (CB-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. A-6-LJS-20-0008 (Abbott, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of Roger Abbott to demolish 5,524 sq.ft., 1-story over basement, single family home and construct 10,385 sq.ft. 2-story over basement single family home; redevelop and replace two existing detached garages on 1.37-acre blufftop lot, at 6340 Camino de la Costa, La Jolla, San Diego, San Diego County.  (AL-SD)

subitem_title: Permit No. A-189-79-A3 (North Coast Village HOA, Oceanside)
subitem_blurb: Request by North Coast Village Home Owners Association (HOA) to amend permit to convert 550-unit apartment complex to condominiums to: maintain existing rock revetment; remove requirement for lateral access boardwalk; after-the-fact approval of revetment maintenance; after-the-fact approval to construct fence around the site; and after-the-fact approval to construct storage shed, at 999 North Pacific Street, Oceanside, San Diego County. (TR SD) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report)

subitem_title: Application No. 1-22-0319 (Papstein, Eureka)
subitem_blurb: Application of Brian and Angie Papstein to merge three legal lots to create approx. 0.21-acre lot and construct one 2,736 sq.ft., 2-story, single-family home with 520 sq.ft. asphalt driveway at 1255 King Salmon Ave., Eureka area, Humboldt County. (CM-A)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 1-22-0711 (Caltrans District 1, Mendocino Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of California Department of Transportation to rehabilitate Highway 1 bridge over Jack Peters Creek with new bridge rails and pedestrian railing; wider shoulders; new separated bicycle and pedestrian path; widened roadway approaches; new guardrail; and strengthened bridge abutments, piers, and foundations, located immediately north of the Town of Mendocino, Mendocino County. (PA-SF)

item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.

item_title: Please note: Items 10b & 11a share a single combined staff report and hearing

subitem_title: Application No. 9-20-0691 (South Coast Water District, Orange County)
subitem_blurb: Application by South Coast Water District to construct and operate a seawater desalination facility in Dana Point with seawater intake wells to be located at Doheny State Beach, in the City of Dana Point, Orange County. (TL-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 9-22-0318 (RTI Infrastructure, Inc., San Luis Obispo Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of RTI Infrastructure, Inc. to install and operate one submarine fiber optic cable extending from one of the four landing pipes in Grover Beach, CA through state and federal waters and terminating in Singapore. (AC-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Consistency Certification No. CC-0004-22 (RTI Infrastructure, Inc., San Luis Obispo Co.)
subitem_blurb: Consistency Certification by RTI Infrastructure, Inc. to install and operate one submarine fiber optic cable extending from one of the four landing pipes in Grover Beach, CA through state and federal waters and terminating in Singapore. (AC-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. E-00-014-A2 (Southern California Edison, San Diego Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application by Southern California Edison to extend the existing authorization term for the Nuclear Horizontal Modular Storage dry storage facility by 13 years, through November 15, 2035, at San Onofre Nuclear Generating Station, San Diego County (HW-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0489 (Orange County Parks, Dana Point)
subitem_blurb: Application of Orange County Parks to repair and maintain 1,250-ft. long revetment by restacking stones within revetment envelope where over-steepened and undersized riprap stones occur, removing rocks along 232 linear ft. of deep slide area seaward of toe of revetment, importing no more than 1,000 tons of 1 to 1.5-ton armorstone to fill exposed areas of buttress fill, and repairing and stabilizing the north and south access ramps and north stairs at Strand Beach, Dana Point, Orange County (SA-LB)

subitem_title: City of Half Moon Bay LCP Amendment Number LCP-2-HMB-21-0078-2 (Short Term Rentals and Home Occupations)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by the City of Half Moon Bay to amend the LCP Implementation Plan to establish new short-term rental provisions and to update existing home occupation standards. (PB-SF)

subitem_title: San Mateo County LCP Amendment Number LCP-2-SMC-22-0004-1 (Child Care Centers)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by the County of San Mateo to revise LCP Implementation Plan provisions regarding child care centers, and if the Commission does not take final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (EM-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: City of Capitola LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-CAP-22-0036-1 Part A (Objective Standards).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing to determine whether the Commission concurs with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Capitola to modify the LCP to establish objective standards for multifamily dwellings and mixed-use residential development is minor and thus should be approved as submitted, and if the Commission objects to such determination, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (KF-SC).
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Grover Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-GRB-22-0030-1 (IP Housing Update). Time Extension Only.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the City of Grover Beach’s proposed LCP Implementation Plan update. (KB-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Morro Bay LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-MRB-22-0032-1 (1260 Main Street).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by the City of Morro Bay to amend the LCP Land Use Plan to change the land use designation for the property located at 1260 Main Street from District Commercial to Community Commercial, and if the Commission does not take a final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (SM-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: San Luis Obispo County LCP Amendment No. LCP-3- SLO-22-0020-1 (Hearst Ranch Cemetery).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by San Luis Obispo County to amend the Land Use Plan land use designation for 4.98-acre area within Hearst Ranch in northern San Luis Obispo County from Agriculture to Rural Residential, and to amend the LCP’s North Coast Area Plan to limit allowed uses on the 4.98-acre area to private family cemetery, passive recreation, and crop production. (EW-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Santa Cruz County LCP Amendment Number LCP-3-SCO-20-0066-2 (Coastal Hazards Update).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by Santa Cruz County to update LCP coastal hazards provisions, including addressing adequate bluff and shoreline setbacks for new and redevelopment, shoreline protective devices, and sea level rise. (TT-SC)

subitem_title: Appeal Number A-3-MCO-22-0039 (Huff, Monterey Co.)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Fred and Gale Krupica (c/o Alex J. Lorca Esq.) from Monterey County decision granting permit with conditions to Daryl and Rhonda Huff (c/o The Lexrupe Living Trust) for construction of single-family home on undeveloped lot at 1125 Spyglass Woods Drive in Del Monte Forest area of unincorporated Monterey County. (SM-SC)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: Pepperdine University Notice of Impending Development No. PEP-NOID-0002-22 (Athletics/Events Center Project).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on Notice of Impending Development by Pepperdine University for construction of the Athletics/Events Center project, consisting of: (1) new 140,720 sq.ft. multi-purpose arena facility with approximately 4,850 seats, sports courts, and related support uses; (2) new 40,000 sq.ft. building with support amenities/facilities for University’s athletics department and student health and wellness programming; and (3) new parking structure with five above-grade levels and two below-grade levels that would contain up to 825 parking spaces, located within an existing surface parking lot in the interior, developed portion of Pepperdine University’s Malibu Campus, Los Angeles County. (DC-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. 4-21-0693 (Caltrans, Malibu)
subitem_blurb: Application by Caltrans to stabilize roadway and protect supporting embankment by removing shotcrete and constructing a secant pile wall in the southbound shoulder of Pacific Coast Highway, 0.1 mile south of Big Rock Drive in Malibu, Los Angeles County. (JS-V)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report For Los Angeles County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0343 (Halikis, Torrance Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Nicholas Halikis to remove 736 sq.ft., unpermitted coastal bluff-face staircase, 800 sq.ft. private bluff-face path, after-the-fact retention of bluff-face timber steps and below-grade stairway footings; restoration with 2,374 sq.ft. native southern coastal bluff plant species at 525 Paseo de la Playa, Torrance Beach, Los Angeles County. (CS-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0618 (Caltrans, Pacific Palisades)
subitem_blurb: Application of Caltrans to restore or replace thirteen culverts along State Route 1.  Project includes to replace and/or retrofit small (<36” diameter or smaller) storm drains at eleven of thirteen locations; replace one 48” Corrugated Metal Pipe culvert; remove concrete culvert and restore natural creek bottom to enable passage and migration for endangered Southern Steelhead Trout at Solstice Canyon Creek (Location 10), at 13 culvert locations along Will Rogers State Beach in Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles County, and the Ventura County line. (JS-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0608 (Popkes, Hermosa Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Donald Popkes to demolish 2-story, 955 sq.ft. single-family home and construct new 30-ft.-high, 2,143 sq.ft. 3-story over basement single-family home  with roof deck and attached 2-car garage and 1 guest parking space on 1,290 sq.ft. lot at 1822 Palm Dr., Hermosa Beach, Los Angeles County. (JD-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0640 (City of Newport Beach, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Newport Beach to construct Confined Aquatic Disposal Facility (CAD) in Lower Newport Harbor where dredged sediment unsuitable for open ocean disposal can be contained, placement of final 3-ft. thick cap layer, and deposition of clean sandy sediments along nearshore ocean beaches and implementation of Operations Management and Monitoring Plan in City of Newport Beach, Orange County (MR-LB).
